answers.answer: To help you better understand t2 diabetes this forum has numerous past discussions covering control and managing glucose levels [blood sugar], proper nutrition, and exercise. Also, the top toolbar has useful links. Take the time to read through them.Without knowing when the 133 mg/dl reference was obtained, the following briefly describes the conditions:133 mg/dl is not considered a normal fasting level, it implies diabetes133 mg/dl is not considered a normal level for non-diabetics 2-3 hours after a meal133 mg/dl is considered a good/OK level for t2 diabetics 2-3 hours after a meal133 mg/dl from random testing is considered by many irrelevantHTH

question: I don't understand anything really how to deal with this but having to watch what I eat and drink and so on but it's not normal is it when your blood suger is 133 or is it?This discussion is related to/posts/show/1055108.
